newsitem.title: UK: LCE coffee reverses to end higher on arb buying.
newsitem.headline: LCE coffee reverses to end higher on arb buying.

text.p: Robusta coffee futures reversed direction in Thursday's afternoon session as a strong arabicas market prompted arbitrage buying interest from fund players in the London market, traders said.
Earlier, selling from origins such as Indonesia knocked robusta prices lower but then buying emerged to take advantage of the higher values in New York, they said.
"Since we broke $1,689 on November, which was the high from last week, we've seen a little bit more fund buying," said one trader.
"Most of the buying up to now was trade buying in London and selling New York against it," he said, adding that there were origin scale-up sellers in both markets.
At the close the benchmark November contract stood up $16 at $1,695, after briefly piercing resistance at $1,700 with its intraday high of $1,705.
All other traded positions ended firmer and overall volume totalled 4,407 lots.

Concerns about a scarcity of available coffee for September in New York -- despite a sharp fall in the contract's open interest -- has kept the arabicas market heated recently with attention centred on the Sept/Dec spread.
